archimate:DataObject.name: Aggregate of Entity
archimate:DataObject.documentation: This "Aggregates" is used that the information described by an Entity in a Aggregate is actually managed in a different aggregate. For example, the Aggregate Customer constains the Entity "Contact Point", this means that the contact points are relevant in the context of the customer and makes sense to be retrieved from to the "customer" aggregate (for example, through the APIs that exposes the customer aggregate). However the contact points are managed in a separate Aggregate because it is information also relevant for other aggregates, such as the "customer communications"
